Photo of Scratch Food & Beverage - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Lamb rilllette
Photo of Scratch Food & Beverage - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Hoodo jinx

FN2cbWeh8u-sZNa0zt8FGQ.text: Scratch is the definition of a neighborhood gem. My brother said his salmon was the best he'd ever eaten. I got one bite of that salmon dish: perfectly crisped skin, moist fish, delicate sides, excellence on a plate. But the starters/veggies/salads are not to be missed! I loved the fresh English pea salad and the black rice arancini...outstanding! Cocktails are great but may be viewed as pricey for this neighborhood. The owner is a fabulous and welcoming host. I want Scratch to succeed in a big way.

photos.caption: Photo of Scratch Food & Beverage - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. You&#39;ll be similarly happy with the salmon at Scratch.
Photo of Scratch Food & Beverage - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Rye cocktail...the bartender knows what he&#39;s doing.

i52lw8wffUFwf3NvP2yg5g.text: 4 of us dined here recently.  Afterwards we discussed our experience and thought, all-in-all: nothing special. For example one dish listed pomegranates - non in evidence.  Another, the main heading was tuna, none that I could find after a close inspection.  Cauliflower "steak" was a big chunk in sauce. Fancy decor, cute mismatched silverware and china,  misspelled "brussel" on the menu, meaning Brussels sprouts. Ordered sparkling water, was brought mineral water.   On the positive side the waitstaff was friendly.

GowCHx11llGNl8XNIxK1cQ.text: We were there on a weeknight, the place was less than half full; our party of four had reservations. The hostess did this weird thing of giving us the worst table, alone in the bar next to a drafty door, and then gave us like the next worst table when we asked to move. Each one is different, part of the eclectic, and appealing, decor. The few best looking tables were unoccupied by anyone the entire night. Not sure of the logic; maybe they were hoping for some more glamorous drop-ins. That being said, the service was pretty good, and the food was really outstanding. Lots of labeled vegan and gluten free options. Would def go again.

mDS537v5Az5mZK9BvIW3jA.text: If you're looking for a warm, intimate place with unique and delicious cocktails and lots of love in the food, this is your place. Scratch is run by a staff that's engaging, knowledgable, and truly seem to enjoy their job. The kitchen is open and is always a joy to watch. The owner is hands on and always willing to listen for feedback. Lots of vegetarian and vegan options. The menu is designed for sharing,  so make sure to try everything you can! This is truly a dining gem, every time!

sVlt-h2lSGBsdMIbMrFaMw.text: My wife and I ate at Scratch last night. It was perfect.  If you like fresh, local creative food in the small plate format, you will love Scratch.  The service was flawless.  The room is cool and comfy.

W9XOWOIvOgBpfSS9cRlDAA.text: The best meal we have had in a long time. Everything was flavorful and like nothing we have eaten before! My fiance hates onions, they were so accommodating. We will definitely be back!

LF4jpeDhf4UK_9UQV1boWQ.text: Wow! What a find! Nice uncomplicated menu without a dizzying array of items for drink and food, but covering all the bases for a foodie! For drinks had an Autumn Mule and a Sunrise in Roatan, both well-crafted cocktails. Had a seasonal collection of small plates, a sweet potato dish, a turkey crepenette, and a carrot, vegan dish. Finished with a pumpkin brulee for dessert. Excellent all around including the service from server Lindsay. Located in a quiet, sleepy neighborhood just a billy goat's climb off Route 28.

jG3jslSDk2hF9fJO0dcnHQ.text: I really, really loved this place. If it were in my neighborhood I would eat there every week. Greeted warmly, seated promptly, service was lovely and knowledgable. We had the olives and the giardineira with our cocktails, both were perfect little bites. We then had the halloumi (which was great) and the tartine (not a good value, mostly bread, but delicious). Water glasses refilled regularly (it makes a difference!) and the wine list is all reasonably priced with good choices. Steak for him, lamb for me, both done perfectly. That salsa verde - DAMN, so good. We declined dessert because we had too many apps, but the server encouraged us to take our time and finish our wine, which I really appreciated. We will be back, Scratch (get it, back-scratch?) :)

aWwc6SIOm2cbwrD3xHOIZw.text: Here's an update for one of my already favorite restaurants. In January, Scratch hired the very talented.Chris O'Brien as Executive Chef. O'Brian has experience with DeShantz Group, Six Penn, Hiehold, and more.   Our meal was crazy good, creative, and heavily vegetable based/farm to table. The Heirloom Tomatoes were extraordinary (he added peaches,  stracciatella cheese and a balsamic reduction).   The cheese plate had this amazing goats milk Camembert  from r&g Farm. Both our entrees were exquisite.   Top it off with great service and a good beverage list.   This is one of the best restaurants in the city.

photos.caption: Photo of Scratch Food & Beverage - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Poached Nectarine
Photo of Scratch Food & Beverage - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chicken
Photo of Scratch Food & Beverage - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Moussaka

NHMcMQDVV4mTJ15aOq7RnQ.text: I cannot say enough wonderful things about Scratch. From the food to the wait staff and hostess---excellent. They made our experience so enjoyable. We came in last Saturday during Restaurant Week and will definitely be back, many, many times. We had a couple concerns about parking, but were pleasantly surprised with the amount of street parking around the restaurant.   When we arrived, Mary, the hostess, greeted us with a smile and was very kind.  David, our server, was attentive and helped make recommendations about some of the starters we were looking at. He was not wrong with his recommendations! Their mushrooms are delicious! It was the perfect size as a starter to share. Their corn soup and peach cobbler were amazing as well. During our meal, the owner Don, stopped by our table to check on us. We appreciated that he took the time to talk to us and make sure everything was satisfactory.  Shortly after our arrival, we had an emergency come up, and everyone was very accommodating and helpful while we had to deal with a slight crisis.  David, Mary, Don and the whole Scratch team- we cannot thank you enough for the hospitality. We will be back soon!

OiIKvitYRiV9EZYI7-IDAQ.text: This place is wonderful. The food is superb, the staff is knowledgeable, and the atmosphere is amazing. I came to Scratch with my family on a Friday night and we left feeling satisfied but not stuffed, and with smiles on our faces.   My sister, my mom, and I are gluten and dairy intolerant (although we eat it occasionally) but the chef was very kind and understanding and went the extra mile to make sure that we felt comfortable eating at this establishment. There are multiple gluten free, dairy free, and vegetarian/vegan options at Scratch so there's something for everyone. For our appetizers, we ordered the moussaka, the baccala deviled eggs, the gravlax, the Spanish marinated mushrooms, and a special halibut ceviche. All of the appetizers were fantastic, but my favorites were the moussaka and the mushrooms. The moussaka had a creamy and thick tomato sauce that was very fresh; and the eggplant was not too mushy. The mushrooms were probably some of the best mushrooms I've ever had, the marinade was perfect and my tastebuds just wanted more.   For dinner, I ended up eating gluten and got the lamb ragu, because our server recommended it and it sounded great. It was worth it, but I actually didn't get a stomachache or any symptoms, which means they probably used a high-quality flour (since their pastas are homemade). The homemade pasta had a nice texture and the lamb was juicy and not too salty. My family members enjoyed their dishes as well, and we were so excited to order dessert. {I honestly could've eaten another lamb ragu for dessert though since it was so delicious!}  For dessert, I had the chocolate cake which was gluten free. It was so decadent and chocolaty; which made my sweet tooth extremely happy.   I would highly recommend Scratch if you are an adventurous foodie and want to have an incredible dinner experience in Pittsburgh.

photos.caption: Photo of Scratch Food & Beverage - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Spanish mushrooms
Photo of Scratch Food & Beverage - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Baccala deviled eggs
Photo of Scratch Food & Beverage - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Ceviche

QlJ_L937M6U1qK4M9F-YNQ.text: We had a delightful dinner here! We always look for a vegan option for my son and there were plenty to chose from. We had a salad for the table with simple greens that were so fresh. I had the trout which was not big portion but fine for me. The atmosphere is quaint. Dorothy was our pleasant server and we were so pleased. We hope to try this place for brunch soon!

oIyOMfq9kzsOm9OMYNKJ6A.text: Came for a birthday dinner. The place has a great ambiance and is tucked away so there's none of that noise you'd get near a nice restaurant in downtown. I knew about the vermouth flight and was excited to try after dinner. I got the gnudi, and had a few bites of the chicken with queso polenta. Both tasted as good as they looked. They have great vegetarian, vegan, and gluten free options, so I'm not worried about accommodating a mix of friends in the future.

photos.caption: Photo of Scratch Food & Beverage - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Three Cheese Gnudi
Photo of Scratch Food & Beverage - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Vermouth flight

ZDWELkI7-XiohttgTsxX-g.text: I'm always thankful when I choose a restaurant based on awesome reviews from my yelp friends... this restaurant in particular, definitely lived up to the hype!   First, of course I waited until the day of to make a reservation... on a Saturday evening for tour people we were able to grab a table at 8:15. The restaurant was packed when we arrived so I would highly recommend making reservations in advance (especially if you would like to come earlier in the evening)  The atmosphere of Scratch is so artistic and cozy. One of my favorite parts about this place was that all of the tableware was mismatched.. the silverware, the dishes, the glasses. I thought it was an awesome touch... just like little pieces of eccentric flair everywhere you looked. Even the salt and pepper shakers on each table were different (we had the cute penguins)   Our food, and service was stellar. During the evening we all looked at each other and mentioned how great the night was going. Our server was very knowledgeable of the menu, and pointed us in the right direction when selecting our food. She also noted that the menu is printed daily so the food rotated frequently.   I'm a vegetarian and I have to say that I was impressed with the amount of food on the menu was meatless. I did sneak a bite of the chicken liver pate and it was amazing.   Everything that we ate was extremely fresh and well prepared. The only thing I will comment on is that although the price per plate was comparable to other restaurants, the portion sizes were a bit small. The mushrooms($6) and ceviche ($10) were absolutely delicious, but the portion size was quite small. Also, my entree (trout) was small for the price, and I would have loved to have some type of vegetable with it, not just the grains.   When we received our checks some of our menu items were charged incorrectly (higher on bill then what was listed on the menu) but our waitress apologized and updated our checks with no issues.

photos.caption: Photo of Scratch Food & Beverage - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Open kitchen
Photo of Scratch Food & Beverage - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Hmmmmm. My wine was delicious, but not quite cold enough. Also small pours.
Photo of Scratch Food & Beverage - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Locust Point Farm Chicken

YMRUuV-ov7wlY4s0S1gPeg.text: Scratch is a True neighborhood gem. It's a small, eclectic restaurant on a back street on Troy Hill. It's hard to categorize. The menu is very limited but adequately diverse. The choices are creative with reasonable prices and portions. We had a pasta and pork entree and, unusually, each had a desert. The food was very good overall. Service started slowly but turned out to be satisfactory. The wine selections were somewhat unusual. Bottle selections were all pretty expensive, but quite fairly priced relative to wine store costs. There were by-the-glass choices that could be bought by the bottle, but the lone Chardonnay wasn't available by the bottle. We will definitely return to try some of the other entrees.

iSwMmi--V43rDI6WFtz2MQ.text: Specialty dinner to celebrate the end of a project. A friend and started with craft cocktails before ordering a couple different small plates. We sat at the bar and had some great conversation with the manager and the bartender. They were both really helpful in giving suggestions on what we should order, not pushing anything. I got a smoky bourbon based cocktail that was amazingly aromatic. My friend got a cucumber collins that was equally intense, but in a completely different way. Both were sippers with intense flavors.  For our meal, we ordered the seafood tartine, the chicken liver mousse, and the octopus. I would suggest at least 2 plates per person if you want a full meal. That said, these were beautifully plated and full of flavor. Fresh seafood, slightly metallic liver (as it should be), briny caviar. Advanced flavors, each standing on its own.

photos.caption: Photo of Scratch Food & Beverage - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

WEw4ib5TNtYWm17diQpsow.text: I really like the setup, layout and decor at Scratch, it's modern with a hint of shabby chic and rustic. Eclectic, homey and comfortable. The service is pretty good too. Servers actually listen and pay attention, answering questions, no matter how many a customer may have they don't lose patience. I've had the rutabaga soup which is beyond amazing and the same can be said about the tagliatelle which is made with walnuts and ricotta. Haven't been back in awhile and really need to see what's new on the menu.

j14O3Y58IBqO9WpjgiZMjw.text: This is a great restaurant hidden in an unknown part of town. The decor is super original and even the mismatched plates make it unique. We came on a weekday and it was pretty empty. Prices were about 19 to 29 for entrees and 8 to 11 for appetizers. I was surprised to not see the salmon I had been looking forward to on the menu, but the beef Bourguignon I ordered was absolutely delicious! My fiance loved the chicken as well. Just be aware that the menu does seem to change fairly often.

photos.caption: Photo of Scratch Food & Beverage - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Beef Bourguignon... As delicious as it looks!

HZINdr8G6mjUjuG2kzu8zw.text: This place is good -- really good.  I'm a bit hesitant to tell you how good it is.  You all have to promise me that you aren't going to make the place so crowded I won't be able to get in any time in the near future.  Went there with a large group and order multiple items from the small plates and entrees.  Every dish had great flavor and was delicious.  Ditto on the desserts.  The place is billed as "comfort food" which it is to some extent, but I don't remember comfort food tasting this good.    It's definitely the type of place where you want to order several items and share.  I would go back in a heartbeat, but I imagine as more people find out about it, reservations will be harder and harder to come by.  You should go try it now before it becomes so popular you won't be able to get in.

106b5QjntjqIl3BkN6_1Ag.text: The food was so good! I had the locust point farm chicken and that chicken breast was so moist! Makes me think they used a sous vide. The sausage was on point, and that poblano verde sauce with the polenta was perfect. We came at 6pm, and we were one of the first customers. It has a very layback atmosphere. The food was a bit pricey, but for what I tasted I think it was worth it. It was also my first time visiting Troy Hill. It has quite a view of downtown! I'd love to come try another dish.

photos.caption: Photo of Scratch Food & Beverage - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Locust Point Farm Chicken

xICnLzxt0HETn1K_Dp8k_w.text: My wife and I went for a date night. Scratch is in the top 3 restaurants in the city. Unpretentious and approachable, a unique spot in the city. If Scratch were in Lawrenceville or East Liberty the chef would be up for a James Beard (that said, please don't move). Literally every flavor combination is on point, the service is amazing, and the story is awesome.  Our menu: Course 1: Marinated mushrooms Salted cod deviled eggs  Course 2: Asparagus salad Gravlax  Course 3: Lamb ragu (Special) trout cake  Course 4: Asparagus salad (it was that good)  Drinks: Vermouth flight Phantom wine 2011  The marinated mushrooms were all flavorful and unique. We were able to pick up the unique flavor of each type of mushrooms and its marinade. The salted cod deviled eggs would be our favorite bite if they were served at any other restaurant in the city.   The asparagus salad was to die for. The fresh flavor of the asparagus and truffle were mixed together to perfection. Sometimes you get a dish with truffle and all that you get is truffle. Here it was a great accent.  The gravlax which was smoked salmon, a small pancake, a fresh slaw, yogurt dressing, and citrus was a great bite and well constructed.   Our mains were delicious, there isn't any way around it. The special trout cakes with roasted vegetables was light and delicious. The lamb ragu. Wow. Typically I would think of ragu as somewhat heavy, but this bucked the trend. It was served of a great perfectly al dente angel hair and prepared with fresh tomatoes and butternut squash. The lamb was perfectly cooked and fell apart; it picked up every flavor. The sauce was not too heavy and mouth watering. I would have licked the bowl if I weren't in public.   Neither of us have the biggest sweet tooth so we opted for another round of asparagus to cleanse our pallets. Again, amazing.   Our drinks were on point. The wine list is complete with a lot to choose from and a price point for everyone. The vermouth flight was both unique and delicious. We both preferred the dry vermouth, but everyone would find something they liked.   Will be going back again soon!

jJvm-poxTxMwcXXfY0kEZA.text: Exceptional!   Awesome jazz brunch, flawless service and great food!  Tucked away at the top of Troy Hill, Scratch is worth the search. The Japanese Pancakes, the Devonshire and the eclectic cocktails will make your visit!

54ywt2eOwR-ejOSxbjE1vQ.text: I moved to Troy Hill in July and although we have been walking around exploring the neighborhood, we haven't really ventured into the local food scene on the North Side much. I lived only a few blocks from Scratch and have heard great things, so when I got home from work last night and really didn't feel like cooking dinner, I figured it was as good a time as any to give it a go. Myself, my 11 and 5 year old, and my 5 year old's dad arrived right as they opened at 5pm. It has a very open and welcoming atmosphere with fun decor, and the kitchen is out in the open so you can see the hustle and bustle.  This place is marked as not good for kids, and while I wouldn't bring them there during a night out meal, we were all hungry, and they are really accommodating despite not having a kids menu. They made my daughter a grilled cheese, and my son had some buttered penne, both of which they have cleaned their plates on prior occasions when their dad had brought them in.  I ordered a Troy Hill Iced Tea to sip on while I looked at the menu; it was stout and tasted delicious! I went with the heirloom tomatoes as a first, since it'll be off the menu soon, and the lamb chops as my main dish. Both were visually pleasing, very nice presentation, and both were very tasty dishes. The heirloom tomatoes were heavy on the basil, which the feta cheese did well to balance the strength. The lamb chops were perfectly cooked and the plating was beautiful!  Service was EXCELLENT, from being very accommodating to our kids, to making sure we were well taken care of. Very nice group of folks working here. The chef even came out to check on us once!  I'd love to come back and explore their menu more, everything on it sounded superb.

36qLSDC8OFYiJ54iQsMvGA.text: I stopped by here this past Thursday night for dinner with my wife.  Honestly I had never heard of Scratch before I saw it as the top rated Pittsburgh restaurant for August 2018 in an email from OpenTable.  Since my wife and I are always game to try a new place we almost immediately made reservations.  We arrived to the restaurant at around 6:20 which was a little bit before our 6:30 reservations and had no trouble getting seated immediately.  The restaurant itself is interesting from the standpoint that you walk into a large bar area first and then an equal sized dining room off to the right.  On the day that we were there the host/hostess wasn't around and so I poked our head into the dining room where we were greeted and seated.  The table where we were sat was a 2 top but was abnormally long and so I felt like I was a lot further away from my wife.  What I did like is that this allowed for multiple dishes to be comfortably on the table at the same time which often isn't the case with 2 tops.  Anyways the decor of the restaurant consisted of hardwood floors, black rooms, track lighting and windows.  There was also a side wall which was made up of squared off sections which had mirrors in a lot of them.  For dinner on this evening my wife and I decided to start off by splitting the patty pan kimchi and duck egg.  The Patty pan kimichi was described as having  gojujang, Calabrian chili, Aleppo chili, sumac, ginger while the Jarosinski Farm Duck Egg was described as having spicy mayo, crispy shallot, chives.  I started off by trying the kimchi which had a nice subtle flavor to it.  None of that funkiness which it can have and then I was actually surprised by the rather tame nature of it considering the gochujang and chiles.  After I finished that I tried the duck egg.  While I would be hard pressed to tell you it was duck egg instead of a chicken egg I did enjoy the spicy mayo with it and loved the textural component that was the crispy shallot.  Then for my dinner entree I ordered the Cavatelli which the menu descrived as English peas, spring onion, basil, ricotta, walnut and pecorino.  The cavatelli was cooked to a perfect al dente and I loved the delicate nature of the sauce.  It both looked and tasted fresh with all of the green that was in it.  My favorite part may have been the walnuts which I initially mistook for bacon (I forgot everything that was in the pasta after ordering) only to crunch into a pleasantly nutty flavor.  Then for dessert my wife and I split the  Olive oil cake which came with house made ricotta and berries.  It was delicious as the cake was moist and the berries added some sweetness.  What really made the dish for me though was the ricotta which added a little saltiness to the dish.  The bottom line for me is that I would head back here again in the future.  Everything that my wife and I tried here was delicious and we both enjoyed our meal.

7_OpWMPuTbMpN-A9AAdViw.text: This spot is lovely. The atmosphere is chill and so cozy. It's not pretentious and it feels like home. The staff are friendly and attentive. The handcrafted drinks are creative and so good! And the food. Oh, the food. We ordered several starters for our group of 5 and I wish I had ordered the Spanish mushrooms for myself, because they were so good I didn't want to share. The pickled veggies were perfect. I'm not a pate person, but my friend practically ate the whole thing with a spoon. I got the beef bourguignon and it was the perfect size and exquisite. The server submitted the wrong dish for a friend, but quickly fixed her mistake by bringing the right dish and left us to share the Locust Point Farm Chicken, which was bright and lovely. We ordered a bunch of desserts to share and the apple spice cake was divine and my favorite. Such a wonderful gem and worth going to regularly!

photos.caption: Photo of Scratch Food & Beverage - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Featuring locally sourced food!
Photo of Scratch Food & Beverage - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Can&#39;t remember the name of this, but it was sour and peachy and wonderful
Photo of Scratch Food & Beverage - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. We got all the desserts.

ohbkGHuS9ybSWKOjTcdx2Q.text: We were told by locals how amazing this place was so we jumped at the only available day of reservation for an earlier than we liked time.  Our table was right by the door an an awkward set up with part table seating part corner bench seating ... oh well, the food we were told was unbelievable.  Unfortunately it was just ok.  Some items better than others.  The cheese polenta/grits were a mushy miss.  The prices reflect local, day of, fresh made but portion sizes (outside of grits) were tiny.  Hopefully you'll hit them on a better night.

FUvGwZLyyRvn0u8RXX-1OA.text: Scratch is definitely a lovely experience! The service was great (our waiter was witty and engaging). Came here for Galentine's Day and had $50 Groupon. We got small plates to share and I had scallops...divine. I had 2 mules to drink...very refreshing. I only wish I had gotten at LEAST one more scallop on my plate. For $30, the plate was definitely skimpy. Overall would absolutely go back and sit at the bar for a different experience. Top marks!

FP6VLijE7g-HB0FDjMRyww.text: Brunch is it! This was a seriously hearty breakfast meal worth sharing among friends. We were visiting from out of town and wanted to have  a meal together on our last day. They take reservations online which was a huge help for our group of 6. The space is cozy and kitschy with mismatched dish-ware and mugs. They also serve dinner and have a bar. The only thing that was a little wonky was the service, there were about 3 different people handling out table, but instead of a seamless flow of roles, it came across confusing to us. We had to double check a couple things after ordering, but it all worked out.  Their menu changes pretty regularly, but expect local, seasonal fare, lots of vegan, vegetarian and gluten free options in the mix too. The coffee was strong and delicious, I enjoyed a couple refills. For my meal, the omelet was a serious win. I was raving about it the whole time I was eating it. Honestly, one of the better omelets I've ever had. The eggs were perfectly cooked and fluffy with the veggies and cheese all baked into the mix - sauteed and well seasoned roasted red peppers, kale, and feta. It came paired with homemade bread. So tasty! My boyfriend enjoyed the basic breakfast plate with bacon, scrambled eggs, and pan-fried home fries (tender and semi-mashed, but crispy edges). Others enjoyed the breakfast sandwich and the pancakes. Overall, everyone was super satisfied with their meals. It was an all around great time!

Uu5YbzcOiNa3FsV8JbSS6Q.text: Very tasty needs a little bigger portions but very good. Tried cricket tacos good. Brussels sprouts very good.

zDJbhmCdCOmxNEsg8QGFng.text: First time at Scratch and it was amazing. Sustainable, delicious food made with love. Menu changes frequently but the mushroom crostini is excellent and I've never had better chicken and biscuits. Highly recommended if you're looking for something different than your usual Pittsburgh cuisine.

J9HvTrbURqWaDQ39AFq_PA.text: Everything about this place is fantastic. Wonderful people, excellent food, comfortable atmosphere. Yinz go check it aght !

ECoXnYZZPuXr6X_Xh5Xh5A.text: Was here once before for brunch which was great. We own a local gym on the north side and we do a monthly burpees & brunch on the last Sunday of every month. We like to support local business in our area. So we chose Scratch & definitely was not disappointed. We had a toddler with us for brunch and the staff brought over a magnetic puzzle for her to keep entertained with. We knew we would return soon & we did but this time on Friday evening for Karaoke. It was again a very nice vibe where everyone seemed welcome. The staff was friendly and accommodating. The only thing that I would mention was that one of members asked for vodka & cranberry and was told that they have no cranberry because they like to use local-which is awesome. However another ordered vodka & oj and it was poured from a Tropicana bottle. 100% for local but just needs to be consistent

q-6nIdPZWALjs8wJ7x7u6Q.text: This is one of my favorite places to splurge. Everything I've tried so far has been awesome. The menu changes (seems to be seasonally), so there are new dishes to try from time to time. My favorite thing right now is the lamb chops. The cocktails are on point too. Nice atmosphere and friendly staff.

DwYqbctJuPSFSf6SXHnkLA.text: We went here last night for a birthday dinner and our experience was incredible. My husband and I decided to go early and check out the bar and happy hour. Our bartender was fun, knowledgeable, and very nice to talk with during our bar visit. He made our first experience at the bar a great one! We tried a few cocktails and a few beers on draft. I love that they place high emphasis on Pittsburgh beers, that is just awesome. The beer that I tasted was from Draai Laag and it was delicious! The bar atmosphere is great....there are games to play, couches to sit on, magnet tiles to build with, and a pinball machine! They even have a little library. I just love that!   We had a party of 5 for dinner and made reservations so our table was ready at 7. Everything on the menu sounded amazing so it was hard to order. My husband and I thought it would be a great idea to split a bunch of items on the menu so we could try more. We started with the brussel sprouts and the poutine fries. The brussel sprouts are out of this world!! I have always been a huge fan of the vegetable, but I have NEVER experienced such a remarkable blend of flavors. WOW. I am still yearning for them this morning and I just ate them last night. Seriously...the best thing EVER. The poutine was also a delight. After we devoured that course of food, we moved onto the chicken and a biscuit. We opted to try it with the maple syrup. HOLY cow...delicious!! The definition of comfort food at its finest. The flavors blended so well together. After we inhaled the chicken and biscuit, we tried the halusky and the risotto. YUM and double YUM. I absolutely loved the flavors in the halusky. Everything meshed so well and it was delightful. The risotto was out of this world...we actually shared this with the table. Everyone loved it!   Scratch is WONDERFUL. If you are looking for a comfortable place to go for dinner or a few drinks, check it out!! It's really close to some cool breweries, too!   Thank you for a great experience!

wFucrJ45HzrCX_JEqXa3uw.text: This place is awesome. The staff are very friendly, and the food is really good. Good options for vegetarians, and the music / vibe is really cool. I totally recommend Scratch

xHpTDHNAcYNkRDHuRR7p6g.text: live just down the street and I was very  excited about a new venue opening up but unfortunately that was the end of my  excitement.  I've given them 3 chances to win me over and each visit was more disappointing than the previous.  All I want is a medium rare burger, a cold beer and fresh cut fries.  Tonight again my burger is medium well, the fries greasy and dry. I could barely swallow it, especially after I watched the bar manager put his fingers in his mouth and wipe them on his shirt and not wash his hands!  I asked for salt to try to improve the tasteless dry burger. It was served in a bullet which is usually used to serve sides of sauce in, who knows whose hands had been in there before mine!  I heard the bar manager talking to two gentlemen who called ahead to ask if they could watch the Penguins game. The bar manager stated that they do not show sporting events unless it's requested?? Is this not Pittsburgh "The City of Champions"!?? The menu keeps shrinking and shrinking.  There is only One kind of dessert.  One of the entrees is grilled cheese and I think that it's  $8.00.  If you cannot cook a burger, then you are in a lot of trouble!  I asked for bacon and mushrooms and the bartender had to make sure that they had them? I'm thinking big slabs of thick bacon, succulent mushrooms and a thick slice of cheese,  no not even close.  The menu states Pennsylvania cheddar cheese and it's shredded? Seriously? The bacon was thin and cooked in the deep fryer. The mushrooms are seasoned with the same seasoning they put on the fries. No flavor.   $10.00 for a small dry burger and a handful of nasty fries. I showed the bartender that my burger was over cooked. She asked me if I wanted another one. No. There were 7 people including me at the bar, two couples at the tables and a few people in the restaurant. 25 minutes for a burger.  She comps my $2.50 beer.  I will not be back. I'm so disappointed. I'm a chef. There's no excuse for over cooked food and unsanitary practices.  They could have had a gold mine. "The Strip" is 5 minutes away where they can order the freshest foods available to serve in this restaurant???  They also have forgotten to cater to the bread and butter that kept "Billy's" in business all those years! What they can't make local food from scratch? You have to work with the clientele that patronize Troy Hill and give them what they want, consistent fresh food at a reasonable price. The place would be packed for lunch and dinner. Run daily specials, put the damn game on and we're happy.  I'm left scratching my head. I wish them all the best but I think by the 4th of July they will be scratched out. Don't go by the reviews on Facebook because it's censored by the restaurant.

nRvGzbpEPcRJMtvvHH7fvA.text: This was my Bday dinner. Me and two others. We had a cocktail in bar Bartender was great met owner very nice guy. Early around 5. Had Brussel sprouts as app. Fantastic. Pasta figule soup not sure of spelling, was ok. Not my idea of the soup but was good. Stroganoff as dinner fabulous. Chicken& biscuit and a Burger and fries dessert was a cherry crisp. A real nice experience and will be back!!!! The price so affordable for great fresh different food.

mJjcfq3iVINEiqAVVSLDrw.text: What a great place. We were in town for a wedding, traveling from Memphis, TN, and decided to the drive around the city and explore after the ceremony. We found Scratch and we are glad we did. It was literally the best food we had while in town. It was great. We were skeptical at first since we didn't know what half the stuff was but oh man. The chicken and biscuit was incredible! The burger was fantastic and the fries were the best we've ever had. Even simple chicken fingers were perfect! The owner was extremely nice and the waitress was as well. Great friendly people with great attitudes. My wife and I highly recommend Scratch and next time we are in Pittsburgh, if we ever are, we will definitely go back.

BZ05h3K4GqHW3sb6TdVSbg.text: Terrible service... I waited about 10 minutes just to order a beer, literally.  The bartender was making a mixed drink on the menu which was fine, but after doing so he decided it was more important to talk to some friends (or co-workers off duty) than to help someone else waiting to get served.  Finally, a different server who randomly showed up ended up taking care of me.  My buddy showed up about another 10 minutes later, and had the same experience.  We looked at each other and could only shake our heads in disbelief.  There's not much competition in the area, at least for what this place is trying to offer anyways, maybe that's why they don't seem to care about service much.

xrYyf4meOd7PAm19xOpRCw.text: Overall I am happy with this place. The service started off very accommodating.  Had a wonderful waitress named Lori who was attentive and sweet.  The food was awesome. The arancini was the best I've ever had. The poutine was also 5 stars. Now, after Lori's shift was over, the service went south quick. The waitress never came to check on our table and I had to flag her down each time for another drink. Not once in about 2 hours did she organically stop to check in. Will I go back? Yes. For sure. And look forward to it. Would have given a solid 4 star rating but the service overall brings my review down to 3.

oROucYxO4mQbo4t3fYfahg.text: Went to Stratch with 3 friends and we had a great meal. Shared a bunch of appetizers and were happy with all - especially loved the Crab Arancini, Cacio e Pepe and the chopped marinated artichokes. But, our favorite was the housemade Ricotta served with warm focaccia - it was amazing! We split the Spring Curry and it was excellent - it had some kick to it - so be aware if you don't like spicy. Overall, an excellent meal and I want to go back soon - looking forward to ordering the Ricotta, trying the lamb sausage and checking out Trivia night.

SoAfgF6rN2ki6e93XAUutQ.text: Such good food! Great service. Lovely atmosphere. You can order everything off the menu and split it. Brussels, shishito peppers, poutine, mushroom crostini... All amazing. Can't go wrong. Would come back as the menu changes. Honestly a gem in the city.

photos.caption: Photo of Scratch Food & Beverage - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Fantastic bar to grab some lite bites and creative cocktails.
Photo of Scratch Food & Beverage - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Great space. Plenty of tables to enjoy your company!

oy9AsHiQYarnJn-SpGThrw.text: Loooove this place!  Had the seitan tacos and couldn't have been happier.  Awesome food and perfect ambience.  I'm thrilled to have a cool hangout on the North Side / Troy Hill.  Think I'll be a regular.

AiiVvf_ngY-NQTdWQrSn5Q.text: I live down the street from the "Old Billy's" according to some of the neighbors and I can tell you straight, this place is the bees knees. They have great beers and fancy foods. Their Reuben is the freaking truth.

As9mIGztPRZ87aNthmKIDw.text: Wow.  Very pleasant surprise.  Went with another couple.  From drinks to food excellent experience.

_iDjWMMVE-Tf3z5NziycPg.text: SO MUCH YES. I got the Reuben and my lady got the low country stroganoff, and they were both delicious and extremely satisfying. Friendly staff, wonderful location, generous portions. I will definitely be coming back. Highly recommended!

aPdgshf0LJFgtc7XBSRmLw.text: I took my grown kids here for brunch, the food and atmosphere is so worth the trip to Troy Hill. Comfortable, great wait staff and the food was excellent. I am a picky vegetarian and found many great choices. Don't miss out on a great meal and great ambiance. I will definitely go back.

5jA1vaz_TYxj7KywsOQ_hQ.text: my husband and I ate at scratches the place looked wonderful the service was not very good yes it was around closing time the chef gave us an attitude we ordered two entrees my husband ordered A pot roast dinner and I ordered a dinner with chicken his pot roast dinner had four pieces  of dice sizes roast one ^ two small golf ball sizes of  my dinner consisted of four pieces of chicken that were no larger than a dice I got one carat 1 baby potatoes the total bill was $36.00, everything was Ella cart but the waitress did not recommend anything because she was in a hurry. When I seen the portions on our plates I almost had a heart attack they were smaller portions that you would receive when you order a appetizer, we left hungry and disappointed we actually stopped at get go to get something to eat because we were starving. We are not cheap,  but we would like to have a meal to eat that would satisfy  us , and we are not heavy people we are actually on the thin side , we are food connoisseurs ,and love to eat out at least four nights a week,in our cases I would definitely not recommend anyone to go there without eating first. The food was delicious but there was nothing on the plates,  pretty good food but very very small portions you will leave hungry.

GwSLKKk_WamkgRdiMUp8LA.text: Warm atmosphere and great food. The New York Strip steak was amazing, one of my favorite steak dishes in Pittsburgh and at a fraction of the cost compared to your upscale steak houses. The menu is limited but changes so check their website for the latest dishes.

7WCjzplRIcU609HL95IppA.text: This place is the best, hip atmosphere and great food. The Hot Chicken and Pig Fries were the best. If your into drinks and cocktails, they have mixologists behind the bar to make you drinks from yesteryear to today. I definitely suggest trying this place for cool place to get some drinks and some great food.

qASCRRW4p7LJBzV-jlwmlw.text: Troy Hill, you got it goin' on! Well, at least in the case of brunch. I can't tell you the last time I was in Troy Hill. Maybe never. Now, I'm ready to be a regular. That's how good the brunch at Scratch was on Sunday. Amongst my group of 4 we had the Breakfast Poutine, Chicken & Biscuit, Beer Cakes and 20 hr Pork Shoulder Hash. Everyone left very satisfied, save for the Beer Cakes buyer. And I agree, they were a bit too drowned in cranberry sauce and, in general, didn't seem that appetizing. The good news for me is that I ordered the Pork Hash and it was INCREDIBLE. Pork shoulder+scallions+egg+grits+other amazing stuff = SATISFACTION. I left full and happy, and at $13, it was the most expensive thing on the menu and worth every single penny. The atmosphere at Scratch is also cozy and welcoming, and the staff is friendly and quick. Unfortunately, they don't serve decaf, which I find silly considering how easy coffee is to make. But if that's the biggest brunch problem I have, then I'm okay with that.

s6XoEdNaktyVI-CQqfR38Q.text: Great new place on Troy Hill!  As you walk in the door you are greeted by a rustic, early 20th century restaurant  ambiance, complete with a library ladder behind the bar and reclaimed rough hewn lumber as trim.   Although service was slow and the waitress delayed taking our food order (odd decision - why not take the order and explain the kitchen i s backed up.) Once we did order our food came quickly.   I chose the Rust Belt Charcuterie platter which was large, very well,priced ($13) and extremely tasty.  My wife had the Chicken + Dumplings ($14).    Excellent taps.  I had a Dry Laag. Catherine and I had well made craft bourbon cocktails.    We will come back. This was an excellent experience, very reasonably priced and worth the trip to Troy Hill!

f2pJUYHrKDe4b3qzVdmSYQ.text: Really not worth the price. I ordered the tagliatelle.  The sauce was bland, and there were not a lot of shrimp.  My husband really enjoyed his pork belly, which is why I gave the 2 star rating instead of 1. The arancini was average, nothing special. Scratch was just no where near as tasty as other restaurants at the same price point. Overall a pretty disappointing meal.  I did like the atmosphere of the bar area, would to back for drinks only.

KXHoB9XD7ZqMGUcaCw6_KA.text: Enjoyed a very pleasant evening at Scratch last night.  The atmosphere is welcoming and cosy.  Our party ordered the artichoke appetizer which was very different and delicious! The heirloom tomato salad had truly local, fresh tomatoes!  Also excellent!  We ordered the trout and the spicy lamb sausage over rice!  Both entrees were perfectly prepared and so flavorful. The green beans with the trout were a big hit!  The chef stopped at our table later in evening.  Very gracious, nice touch. We ordered the vanilla and chocolate desserts which were gone in minutes!  I liked the fact that portions were nice size not too large.  Also it was a pleasure having just a few choices for a change.  Loved the evening and will return for sure!

T85kIXWOwPgOC2HBPLUHMw.text: We went for an early dinner on NYE. The place has a really unique yet comfortable vibe and ambiance. Our server was very helpful in describing the dishes and making recommendations. The food was absolutely delicious. The main dishes were pricey given the portion size was much more like a lunch plate. That being said, it was worth the food quality.  It was REALLY cold in the bar side which is where our table was. I had my coat and gloves on. Overall I would recommend this place if you're looking for a delicious meal.

p8GO3HAcrHHG42SibSlPow.text: The food was great, but a little expensive. But two appetizers and one entree was enough for two people! The beer selection is pretty good and all local breweries. I would definitely return!

8Si9F6Z4C5UO0Zh9r3FQ9g.text: Nice energy with great curry of all things. I highly recommend the corn dip - so delicious !!

ZzlbiHTwrTW_mmSSGDzPdQ.text: Wow this place has a new menu and it is really spectacular.  We had the homemade ricotta on amazing grilled bed.  So creamy.  We loved the two salads- they are really unique- the kale ceasar and the citrus salad with pistachios (blood oranges and grapefruit) with an amazing dressing which was so light and refreshing.  The gnochi was really light and the chicken was about as tender as I have ever had with a fresh lemon sauce.  The two deserts were amazing.  I have been to some top restaurants all around the world but these deserts were the best I have had- try the smores and the panna cotta.  Delicious.  Chef Brandon is a star!!!  We love that he is changing the menu and bringing new flavors.  The decor is very comfy- a great place for a great evening with friends and family.

asODFQkeVKHi8x2DPY-V0w.text: I would give this less than one star if I could.  This was definitely the slowest service I've seen in a really long time.  We both had the burger and fries.  I'm not sure why the  staff kept saying "Isn't the burger AMAZING?!" because I'm pretty sure I could go to Costco and get a 24 pack of frozen burger patties and have a better meal than I did there.  Also, if you're going to charge for ranch on the side, you might want to give the diner more than a .25 ounce serving.  The fries were good but with the amount of salt dumped on them, you'll need about a gallon of water with your meal.  TLDR - Don't waste your time.  Go somewhere else.

KcJhcKsiWcrZTwDXPChtuw.text: Let me start off by saying that I WANT to like Scratch and because of that, I am willing to let minor things slide.  My first experience at Scratch was one I would consider average. I love the concept of taking you back to eating in your grandmothers kitchen. The comfort food and mismatched place settings add to the charm. I was a little put off by the tarnished silverware, but I get it. The drinks were pretty decent, but it seemed like the bartender wasn't stirring or mixing the drinks. I realized this after I got to the bottom of my first drink. The food, however, was fantastic. I am a huge Brussel sprout fan and I feel that they have some of the best in the city.  Tonight was my second time returning to Scratch. We did not have a reservation when we arrived. When we asked for a table for two, the girl replied with, "You don't have a reservation? We're pretty booked tonight." I asked if there was a wait time and if we could hang out at the bar and drink. She looked at the computer and replied with, "Looks like it's about a thirty minute wait." My fellow diner point out two open tables in the bar and the girl replied with, "Well...that one is reserved, but that other is open. Let me get someone to bus it for you." Already off to a bad start. We get seated and our waiter, who was also the bartender, came over and took or order. He was a delightful character, very upbeat and positive. We ordered a cocktail, soup, two appetizers, and our main courses.  My cocktail arrived and was quite good. No complaints there. This was the last time we saw our waiter. Another server brought out our food...our main courses. I politely asked for our soup and appetizers which were promptly brought out to us by two other servers. The timing of things could have just been a little better. The food was fantastic once again, however we did order the pate which was a larger than average portion, but only came with four little baguette slices. When we asked for more bread, they gave us three more slices. Half way into my meal, my water glass was empty. It continued to sit empty through the meal, then through the twenty minutes we sat there waiting for the bartender/server to bring us our check. Literally sat there for 20-25 minutes with empty plates, no drinks, while the bartender continued chatting with his friend's. it wasn't until another waitress noticed the annoyed look on my face that she asked if we wanted our check. Finally here comes the bartender! All smiles to hand us our check! I work in customer service and I am the type of person that will still leave a tip for less than satisfactory service. But come on! Making sure a guests water glass is always full is rule number one for any serving job!! I still left a tip although I'm sure it's not what he was expecting. The last thing that really killed me was the fact that when we arrived, the host made it sound like it would be impossible for us to get a table, yet as we sat and ate, the restaurant began clearing out. To the point that it was just us and two other tables. Why did you make such a big out of the fact that we didn't have a reservation when we were clearly able to pick out our own table and the restaurant was empty by the time we finished our meal? I'm sorry. I really want to like Scratch, but the service is very lackluster.  I only gave two stars because I really think the food is fantastic.

cn2mDaFu78g0pvJY5KlWtA.text: A very inviting place with great food and beer selection. Nestled in the Troy Hill neighborhood, very attentive, friendly, and fun staff to take your orders. The atmosphere is fantastic and the food was sublime. Enjoyed Grist House Fire on the Hill on tap.

24j3MP2IWplofYTif78Mkg.text: I love this place!! Great food! Great people! Amazing DJ. I celebrated my birthday here with a big group and we had such a great time!!! Do try the Brussel sprouts and the vege tacos!!!   Will come back for sure!! Thank you to the scratch team for their amazing service!!

pL3u4r-KO4egsOtUCKUsxw.text: To risk braving the terror that is Rialto Street you better be damn good. Sadly, though Scratch was pretty decent, it was not good enough for me to risk that hill ever again.

aqe_MmlnJRERvspQ2IVLFg.text: The food was excellent and clearly made from scratch. The menu was not large, but it seems that the smaller menu meant that each item was carefully crafted.  The atmosphere was intentional and the wait staff were great. Apparently there is karaoke on certain nights. Recommend.

fUEUPnw1XA9yMW71NLUAFA.text: Cool spot. Vintage unique decor and placeware. Friendly staff. Quick service. Small plates great for sharing. Great beer list and funky cocktails. Really tasty food. Unique takes on classic dishes. Tons of fun games to keep busy. Will certainly be back, given the rotating menu.

nd1W-oeFBxOdNtUAXtKJgw.text: A great place for unique dishes and drinks. Great staff to assist you with ordering. I will definitely return with friends. Pittsburgh has truly become a foodie haven. Scratch is certainly a great place for inexpensive good food and great unique beverages. The poutine is delicious. If you don't know what poutine is, give it a try!!!

X87eJRFtwr1346Sj9aUvkg.text: I love this place. It used to be Billy's, a neighborhood bar with average bar food. The remodel is breathtaking but the friendly neighborhood service remains. They have a rotating menu (check out the website to see what's on this week) for food and cocktails, and they seem to rotate their beer selection as well. As a regular, I was at first put out by this (but what about last week's favorite??) but I've grown to enjoy the variety. Friendly, warm staff and home cooked food, what's there not to love.

BiJpJqCBRZAUXN7YJBfhDA.text: I had been to Billy's many times before, and was excited to see what would replace it. Scratch doesn't disappoint. Their chicken and biscuit is incredible, and they've got a great draft selection and interesting cocktail list. They change out their menu often (a little often for my taste. I found a sandwich I loved and it was gone the next time I went...only a few days later), but I've always liked what I've gotten (with the exception of carne asada tacos, which were a little dry). The staff is very nice. We've gone for trivia on Tuesday nights, and it's been great. A really nice addition to Troy Hill.
